Dashboard source index data ranges table

This table provides you the date ranges of the data within the indices on which this dashboard is built. There are two categories:

### Elastic Service Billing integration

These data sources contain data of all the deployments which are part of your Organisation. These indices are:
- `metrics-ess_billing.billing-default`: this data stream is transformed to provide information for the billing section of this dashboard.
- `billing_cluster_cost`: the transformed billing data.

### Elasticsearch integration

This data is the data that is sent to your Monitoring cluster with the Elasticsearch integration.
- `monitoring-indices`: this index is transformed to provide information for the consumption section of this dashboard.
- `cluster_datastreams_contribution`: the transformed consumption data, grouped by data streams.
- `cluster_deployment_contribution`: the transformed consumption data, grouped by deployments.

# Enrich policy content

The tag cloud provides insight into which deployments have been processed by the enrich This dashboard will require Elasticsearch monitoring data (built-in or Metricbeat module / Elasticsearch integration) to be collected in this cluster, **and** the `logs-elasticsearch.index_pivot-default` [transform](/app/management/data/transform) to be started.

This dashboard will provide tier- and data stream-centric consumption information, such as:
* Ingest volume (written on disk, after indexing by Elasticsearch).
* Query volume (by count and time).
* Storage volume.
